N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 12-2.3 - Melting apparatus

State Regulations

Vessels operated at or in excess of the temperature of
volatilization of toxic metals, alloys or compounds which generate dangerous
air contaminants shall be provided with local exhaust ventilation. Vessels used
for melting or cleaning such metals, alloys or compounds shall be provided with
exhaust ventilation when operated in such a manner as to generate dangerous air
contaminants. The combustion chamber, when operated in such a manner as to
release dangerous air contaminants, shall be provided with local exhaust
ventilation. Exception: Portable receptacles or apparatus which have no fixed
location and are used intermittently and which produce no dangerous air
contaminants. Notes
